section.title: Sales Functionality Setup
section.para: The Sales section provides the administrator with the ability to set up the following parameters:

listitem.para: Sort order of total fields on the shopping cart Checkout page
Reorder of items from an already created order
Logos and an address to be displayed on PDF print-outs and HTML print view of invoices and packing slips
Minimum order amount functionality
Multi-address messages for an order or for each item in an order

section.para: Locate the Sales section by clicking System > Configuration > Sales > Sales.

section.title: Checkout Totals Sort Order
section.para: The order of checkout totals located in the Order Review field group of the Checkout page depends on the values specified under the Checkout Totals Sort Order field group in the Sales section parameters. The values specified in this group only influence the display of the total fields sort order in the shopping cart Checkout page, they have no influence on calculation order. Specify the sort order values for the following fields:

note.para: A number of related parameters must be set up to include the Discount and Fixed Product Tax fields under the Order Review field group of the Checkout page. The setup of these parameters will be covered further on in this tutorial.

section.title: Reorder
section.para: With the Reorder field, the administrator can specify whether the user can create an order from an already placed order.

note.para: Keep in mind that you cannot use the Reorder function from orders containing items of the Bundle Product and Configurable Product product types.

section.para: The user can simply reuse all the information from the initial order or enter some changes concerning the number of items to order, shipping and billing addresses, shipping and payment methods, etc.

section.title: Invoice and Packing Slip Design
section.para: An administrator can perform the setup of logos and an address to be included in HTML and PDF printed invoices and packing slips. The following fields help perform the design setup:

listitem.para:
Logo for PDF print-outs (200*50) - browse for an image to include on a printed PDF invoice. After an invoice is created, the administrator can locate the list of all created invoices in the backend by following the path Sales > Invoices and select a check box for a single or multiple invoices. Then, in the Actions field, he or she needs to select the PDF Invoices option and click the Submit button.
Files of the .jpeg, .tiff, and .png formats can be specified in this field.

Logo for HTML print view - browse for an image to display on a printed HTML print preview and on its printed paper copy. In the frontend, the user can view an invoice, shipment, or refund print preview containing the specified in this field image. To view the list of orders, the registered user needs to open the My Orders page by clicking the My account link located in the upper right corner of the store page and click the My Orders Navigation Pane button. For the required order, click the View Order link. In the order page that opens, in the About This Order area, click the Invoices link. Under the shipping and billing addresses, click the Print Invoice link and view the print preview of the invoice containing the image specified in the Logo for HTML print view field of the backend.
The image specified in this field is also displayed on the shipment and refund print previews for the selected order. Images of the .jpeg, .gif, and .png file formats can be specified in the Logo for HTML print view field.
Address - type an address to display on a print preview of an order invoice, shipment, or refund. The address can be viewed in the upper left corner of the print preview.

section.title: Minimum Order Amount
section.para: The fields under the Minimum Order Amount field group let the administrator specify the minimum amount allowed on the order creation. When placing an order with the amount less than specified in the Sales section parameters, the user will not be able to procede to the shopping cart checkout.

listitem.para: Enable - select this parameter to specify whether the Minimum Order Amount functionality is applied to the shopping cart.

Minimum amount - type the minimum amount which will be validated while adding an item to the shopping cart and trying to check it out. If the subtotal amount of ordered items in the shopping cart after a discount is less than that specified in this field, Magento will not allow the user to procede to the checkout.
Description message - type the message stating that the shopping cart order amount is less than the amount required for the checkout.
Error to show in shopping cart - ??? (A bug was created as it seems that this field is not used in the system)
Validate each address separately in multi-address checkout - select this check box to specify that for each address on an order, the minimum order amount will be separately validated.
Multi-address description message - type the message stating that the order amount of a shopping cart for one or all shipping addresses is less than the amount allowed for shopping cart checkout.
Multi-address error to show in shopping cart - ??? (This can be of the same issue as the Error to show in shopping cart field.)

section.title: Gift Messages
section.para: A user is able to type a gift message for a person to get the shipping list if the following fields are set up by the backend administrator:

listitem.para: Allow Gift Messages on Order Level - select this check box to let the user type a gift message for the entire order.
Allow Gift Messages for Order Items - select this check box to provide the user with the ability to type a gift message for each item in the user's order.

note.para: The user can type gift messages for either the entire order or for each item in the order by selecting the Do you have any gift items in your order? check box located under the Shipping Method field group on the Checkout page.

section.title: Sales Emails Functionality Setup
section.para: E-mail letters confirming an order, invoice, shipment, or credit memo can be sent to both registered customers and store guests if this is set up in the Sales Emails section. Here, the administrator can specify an e-mail sender, the templates to be used for mailing customers, and e-mail addresses to send a copy of a letter to. She or he can also specify whether the comments on an order, invoice, shipment, or credit memo will be sent to the customers. The following two subsections describe the setup of Order and Order Comments e-mails; the Invoice, Shipment, and Creditmemo areas are set up the same way.
Locate the Sales Emails section by clicking System > Configuration > Sales > Sales Emails.

section.title: Order
section.para: Set up the following parameters to send an e-mail letter for an order confirmation:

listitem.para: Enabled - specify whether an e-mail letter is sent to the customer after an order is created.
New Order Confirmation Email Sender - specify an e-mail address from which a customer will be sent an order confirmation e-mail letter. An administrator is provided with the following options:

note.para: Addresses for the specified options are defined under the following path: System > Configuration > General > Store Email Addresses.

listitem.para: New Order Confirmation Template - specify a template for an order confirmation e-mail letter. The letter based on the selected template will be sent to a registered customer. In the field, you can either leave a system template or choose your own customized one.

note.para: Create customized templates from the Transactional Emails page which can be located by clicking System > Transactional Emails.

listitem.para: New Order Confirmation Template for Guest - specify a template for an order confirmation e-mail letter to be sent to a store guest, that is an unregistered user. Here, you can also choose from a system template or your own customized ones.
Send Order Email Copy To - type an e-mail address to which a copy of an order confirmation letter will be sent.

note.para: If more than one address must be specified in the field, separate them by a comma.

listitem.para: Send Order Email Copy Method - if you specified a single or multiple e-mail addresses in the Send Order Email Copy To field, choose whether to send a separate e-mail letter to each adressee or to send e-mails using the Bcc sending method (the To field in an e-mail letter contains only the addressee's e-mail address).

section.title: Order Comments
section.para: The following parameters must be set up if it is required to send order comments to the customer or store guest:

listitem.para: Enabled - specify whether it is possible to add comments on an order to the customer's order confirmation e-mail letter. When this parameter is enabled, the Notify Customer check box appears in the Comments History area of the Order page. Selecting the check box

Order Comment Email Sender - specify an e-mail address from which a customer will be sent an e-mail letter containing comments on the order. The options are: General contact, Sales representative, Customer support, Custom email 1, and Custom email 2.

Order Comment Email Template - specify a template for an e-mail letter to be sent to a registered customer. The letter based on the template will include the comments written in the Comments field of the Order page's Comments History area. In the field, you can choose whether to use a system template or a customized one created by you on the Transactional Emails page (System > Transactional Emails).

Order Comment Email for Guest - specify a template for an e-mail letter to be sent to a store guest. In the field, you can specify whether a system or a customized template will be used as a basis for an e-mail letter containing comments on an order.
Send Order Comment Email Copy To - type an e-mail address to send a copy of an e-mail letter containing the comments on an order.

Send Order Email Copy Method - if you specified a single or multiple e-mail addresses in the Send Order Comment Email Copy To field, choose whether to send a separate e-mail letter to each adressee or to send e-mails using the Bcc sending method (the To field in an e-mail letter contains only the addressee's e-mail address).

section.title: PDF Print-outs Functionality Setup
section.para: Choose whether to display an order identification for an invoice, shipment, and/or credit memo's header by setting up the corresponding parameters under the Invoice, Shipment, and Credit Memo field groups.
Locate the PDF Print-outs section by clicking System > Configuration > Sales > PDF Print-outs.

section.title: Tax Functionality Setup
section.para: Locate the Tax section by clicking System > Configuration > Sales >Tax.

section.title: Tax Classes
section.para: Tax class charged on a shipping amount is specified in the Tax Class for Shipping field. Prior to setting this parameter, you can create your own tax class on the Product Tax Class page which can be located by following the path: Sales > Tax > Product Tax Classes.

listitem.para: Tax Calculation Method Based On - choose whether the tax calculation is based on one of the following methods:
Unit Price - tax calculation is applied to the unit price of a single product
Row Total - tax calculation is applied to the total price of a single products' quantity
Total - tax calculation is applied to the total price amount of all products
Tax Calculation Based On - choose whether tax calculation will be based on customer's shipping, billing address or based on the shipping origin.
Catalog Prices - specify whether product prices in the catalog include taxes.
Shipping Prices - choose whether shipping prices in the shopping cart include taxes.
Apply Customer Tax - choose whether to apply a customer tax prior to subtracting a discount from the subtotal or after it.
Apply Discount On Prices - ???

Apply Tax On - choose whether to apply tax calculation to a base price of an item for all store views or, if the price of the product varies depending on the store view, to a custom price for a specific store view.

Display Shipping Prices - choose whether you want to display shipping prices with taxes included or without them. Here, you can also specify that both shipping prices including and excluding tax are presented in the
Display Prices - choose whether to display product prices in the shopping cart with taxes included or without them. Both prices can be displayed if the corresponding option is selected in the field.

Display Subtotal - specify whether the subtotal for the products in the shopping cart include taxes. Both subtotals can be displayed in the shopping cart if the Including and excluding tax option is selected in the field.

Display Shipping Amount - choose whether shipping amount for the products in the shopping cart will include taxes or not. You can also see both shipping amounts with included and excluded taxes if the corresponding option is selected.

Include Tax in Grand Total - choose whether the grand total displayed on the shopping cart Checkout page will include the taxes or not. There is a possibility to view both grand totals with included and excluded taxes if the corresponding option is selected in this field.

Display Prices - choose whether to display product prices with taxes included or without them in the order/invoice/credit memo Totals area. Both prices can be displayed if the corresponding option is selected in the field.

Display Subtotal - specify whether the subtotal for the products in the order/invoice/credit memo Totals area include taxes. Both subtotals can be displayed if the Including and excluding tax option is selected in the field.

section.title: Checkout Functionality Setup
section.para: The Checkout section allows the administrator to set up the following parameters:

listitem.para: Checkout to different types of shipping addresses, guest checkout, and terms and conditions of product checkout
Period of product availability in the shopping cart, products' images, and redirect to the shopping cart after adding a product
My Cart link display with either the number of products or the quantity of items in the shopping cart specified
Display of the Shopping Cart sidebar and the number of products in the Recently Added items area

section.para: Locate the Tax section by clicking System > Configuration > Sales > Checkout.

section.title: Checkout Options
section.para: Among the options which are provided by this subsection are the ability to check out to single and multiple addresses or to multiple addresses only. The administrator can also choose whether to allow store guests to check out products and can also enable the term and conditionsa functionality for checking out an item.

listitem.para: Enable Onepage Checkout - specify whether the user will have the ability to check out to both a single and multiple shipping addresses or to multiple shipping addresses only. If you select not to enable onepage checkout, the Procede to Checkout button no longer appears on the Shopping Cart page.

Allow Guest Checkout - specify whether only registered customers can perform a product checkout. If you choose to not allow guests to procede to product checkout, the Checkout Method section of the Checkout page will require the user to enter his or her e-mail address and password prior to starting the checkout process.
Enable Terms and Conditions - choose whether to enable the terms and conditions functionality. The user will need to accept the terms and conditions to be able to palce an order.

note.para: Make sure that store views are selected for the Terms and Conditions record created under Sales > Terms and Conditions.

section.title: Shopping Cart
section.para: This parameter subsection allows the administrator to set several rules which will be applied to the period of product's availability in the shopping cart and the images that will be displayed for certain product types. It also provides the ability to direct the user to the shopping cart after a product is added.

listitem.para: Quote Lifetime (days) - specify the number of days a product will be available in the shopping cart. In case the customer does not enter her or his account in the store within the period specified in the field, the item will be removed from the shopping cart.

After adding a product redirect to shopping cart - choose wether to simply add a product to the shopping cart and stay on the currect page or to add a product and be redirected to the Shopping cart page.
Grouped product image - choose what image to display for a product of the type Grouped Product. The options are as follows:
Product Thumbnail Itself
Parent Product Thumbnail
Configurable product image - choose what image to display for a product of the type Configurable Product. This can also be either an image of a parent product or of a product itself.

section.title: My Cart Link
section.para: The My Cart link in the upper right corner of a store can display either the number of products in the shopping cart or the total quantity of items placed there. The administrator can set this up by selecting a corresponding option in the Display Cart Summary field of the My Cart Link section.

section.title: Shopping Cart Sidebar
section.para: The administrator can control the display of a shopping cart and the number of recently viewed items in the sidebar. Review the following fields to be able to perform this:

listitem.para: Display Shopping Cart Sidebar - choose whether to display a shopping cart in the right sidebar. In case the administrator chooses to not display the shopping cart in the sidebar, the customer can locate it by clicking the My Cart link in the upper right corner of a store.
Maximum display Recently Added item(s) - specify the number of recently selected products to be displayed in the Recently added items area.

section.title: Payment Failed Emails
section.para: [[For Nadia: intro sentence is required]]

listitem.para: Payment Failed Email Receiver - specify an e-mail address of the receiver that will be sent an e-mail letter containing information about a failed payment. The options are: General contact, Sales representative, Customer support, Custom email 1, and Custom email 2.

Payment Failed Email Sender - specify an e-mail address from which a receiver will be sent an e-mail letter containing information about the failed payment. The options are: General contact, Sales representative, Customer support, Custom email 1, and Custom email 2.

Payment Failed Template - specify a template for a payment failed e-mail letter. The letter based on the selected template will be sent to the address specified in the Payment Failed Email Receiver field. In the field, you can either leave a system template or choose your own customized one.
Send Payment Failed Email Copy To - type an e-mail address to which a copy of an e-mail letter stating that the payment failed will be sent.

note.para: If more than one address must be specified in the field, separate them by a comma.

listitem.para: Send Payment Failed Email Copy Method - if you specified a single or multiple e-mail addresses in the Send Payment Failed Email Copy To field, choose whether to send a separate e-mail letter to each adressee or to send e-mails using the Bcc sending method (the To field in an e-mail letter contains only the addressee's e-mail address).
